feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [composer/composer] Composer allows cache poisoning from other projects built on the same host
entry.content:
Composer before 2016-02-10 allows cache poisoning from other projects built on the same host. This results in attacker-controlled code entering a server-side build process. The issue occurs because of the way that dist packages are cached. The cache key is derived from the package name, the dist type, and certain other data from the package repository (which may simply be a commit hash, and thus can be found by an attacker). Versions through 1.0.0-alpha11 are affected, and 1.0.0 is unaffected.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8371
  • https://flyingmana.de/blog_en/2016/02/14/composer_cache_injection_vulnerability_cve_2015_8371.html
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/e26be423c5bcfdb38478d2f92d1f928c15afb561/composer/composer/CVE-2015-8371.yaml
  • https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/advisories-community/-/blob/main/packagist/composer/composer/CVE-2015-8371.yml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-725m-w832-q973

entry.title: [neos/neos-ui] Neos CMS Cross Site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Neos CMS 8.3.3 allows a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SVG file to the neos/management/media component.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37611
  • https://rodelllemit.medium.com/stored-xss-in-neo-cms-8-3-3-9bd1cb973c5b
  • https://github.com/neos/neos-ui/releases/tag/8.3.4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6qjf-7g3j-qx25

entry.title: [librenms/librenms] Cross site scripting in librenms
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - DOM in GitHub repository librenms/librenms prior to 23.9.1.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5060
  • https://github.com/librenms/librenms/commit/8fd8d9b06a11060de5dc69588a1a83594a7e6f72
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/01b0917d-f92f-4903-9eca-bcfc46e847e3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2q8c-gqf4-mg3v

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] File Upload vulnerability in Dolibarr ERP CRM
entry.content:
File Upload vulnerability in Dolibarr ERP CRM v.17.0.1 and before allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code and obtain sensitive information via the extension filtering and renaming functions.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38887
  • https://akerva.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/AKERVA_Security-Advisory_CVE-2023-38887_Dolibarr_AFU.pdf
  • http://dolibarr.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g8h7-mcp6-pf47

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr allows a remote privileged attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted command/script
entry.content:
An issue in Dolibarr ERP CRM v.17.0.1 and before allows a remote privileged attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted command/script.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38886
  • https://akerva.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/AKERVA_Security-Advisory_CVE-2023-38886_Dolibarr_RCE-1.pdf
  • http://dolibarr.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6773-rfjv-c54w

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Cross Site Scripting vulnerability in Dolibarr ERP CRM
entry.content:
Cross Site Scripting vulnerability in Dolibarr ERP CRM v.17.0.1 and before allows a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information and execute arbitrary code via the REST API module, related to analyseVarsForSqlAndScriptsInjection and testSqlAndScriptInject.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-38888
  • https://akerva.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/AKERVA_Security-Advisory_CVE-2023-38888_Dolibarr_XSS.pdf
  • http://dolibarr.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-62wf-h26v-5m57

entry.title: [yiisoft/yii2] Yii2 allows attackers to execute any local .php file via a relative path in the view parameter
entry.content:
web\ViewAction in Yii (aka Yii2) 2.x before 2.0.5 allows attackers to execute any local .php file via a relative path in the view parameeter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-5467
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/yiisoft/yii2-dev/CVE-2015-5467.yaml
  • https://www.yiiframework.com/news/87/yii-2-0-5-is-released-security-fix
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7cfq-72w2-24q4

entry.title: [noumo/easyii] Cross-Site Request Forgery in easyii CMS
entry.content:
A vulnerability was found in easyii CMS. It has been classified as problematic. Affected is an unknown function of the file /admin/sign/out. The manipulation leads to cross site request forgery. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-36534
  • https://vuldb.com/?id.160278
  • https://github.com/noumo/easyii/issues/222
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3x3w-vcjx-7796

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] SQL Injection in Subrion CMS
entry.content:
SQL Injection vulnerability in Subrion CMS v4.2.1 in the search page if a website uses a PDO connection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-18155
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/817
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/c29cd72d07ca8cf6eba6f6d4496ad97d0c4d2be9
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7q44-gfvq-6g93

entry.title: [simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp] SimpleSAMLphp allows timing side-channel attacks
entry.content:
The (1) Htpasswd authentication source in the authcrypt module and (2) SimpleSAML_Session class in SimpleSAMLphp 1.14.11 and earlier allow remote attackers to conduct timing side-channel attacks by leveraging use of the standard comparison operator to compare secret material against user input.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12872
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2017/12/msg00007.html
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/06/msg00017.html
  • https://simplesamlphp.org/security/201703-01
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp/commit/b72c79e3070f930d758f5c269333d63ed7509e2e
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v882-949x-6v28

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
uploads/.htaccess in Subrion CMS 4.2.1 allows XSS because it does not block .html file uploads (but does block, for example, .htm file uploads).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-14840
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/773
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/cb10ac2294cb2c3a6d2159f9a2bb8c58a2a10a47
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45150/
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/b12e287d3814c0f2d0b1892f95fc0190972d2ba5
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vhqr-3gr2-7px9

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
There are CSRF vulnerabilities in Subrion CMS 4.1.x through 4.1.5, and before 4.2.0, because of a logic error. Although there is functionality to detect CSRF, it is called too late in the ia.core.php code, allowing (for example) an attack against the query parameter to panel/database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15063
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/547
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/570
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/5fdf03af1a7d89c3692faa155e17457153020dca
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/65fb937a588d730e57da0c2c5ca3bc4b9c2b5628
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rc94-7v55-wmg6

entry.title: [typo3/cms] Typo3 XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
The page module in TYPO3 before 8.7.11 has XSS via $GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['SYS']['sitename'], as demonstrated by an admin entering a crafted site name during the installation process.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-6905
  • https://forge.typo3.org/issues/84191
  • https://github.com/pradeepjairamani/TYPO3-XSS-POC
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040755
  • https://github.com/TYPO3/typo3/commit/d2c0ea7db3b31a796a82f9d39f77f9983beb7c35
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3w22-wrwx-2r75

entry.title: [typo3/cms-core] Typo3 Cross-Site Scripting in Link Handling
entry.content:
TYPO3 8.3.0 through 8.7.26 and 9.0.0 through 9.5.7 allows XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-12748
  • https://typo3.org/cms/release-news/typo3-8-release-notes/
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-core-sa-2019-015/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r6fv-56gp-j3r4

entry.title: [typo3/cms-core] Typo3 Cross-Site Scripting in Link Handling
entry.content:
TYPO3 8.3.0 through 8.7.26 and 9.0.0 through 9.5.7 allows XSS.

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type in Croogo
entry.content:
A Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability exists in Croogo 3.0.2 via admin/file-manager/attachments, which lets a malicious user upload a web shell script.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44673
  • https://github.com/3erk1n/Vulnerabilities/blob/main/Croogo%203.0.2%20-%20Arbitrary%20File%20Upload-Remote%20Code%20Execution%20(Authenticated).txt
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4pww-fqgh-36hj

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo vulnerable to XSS in Blog field
entry.content:
A stored-self XSS exists in Croogo through v3.0.5, allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable Blog field to /admin/nodes/nodes/add/blog.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7168
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/886
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/commit/cafaaabe2cef3d1d83652370e30563e6ad7c4158
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9f9r-w3xq-f722

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo vulnerable to XSS in title field
entry.content:
A stored-self XSS exists in Croogo allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable Title field to /admin/taxonomy/vocabularies.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7170
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/890
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/commit/cafaaabe2cef3d1d83652370e30563e6ad7c4158
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-36pq-cjh9-fv46

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo vulnerable to XSS in title field
entry.content:
A stored-self XSS exists in Croogo through v3.0.5, allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable Title field to /admin/blocks/blocks/edit/8.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7171
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/887
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/commit/cafaaabe2cef3d1d83652370e30563e6ad7c4158
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v6q8-8wgx-8hm7

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo vulnerable to XSS in title field
entry.content:
A stored self-XSS exists in Croogo through v3.0.5, allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable Title field to /admin/menus/menus/edit/3.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7169
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/888
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/commit/cafaaabe2cef3d1d83652370e30563e6ad7c4158
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wr5c-4f2h-28m6
